abstract.text: A format style that shows durations with localized labeled components

legalNotices.copyright: Copyright © 2025 Apple Inc. All rights reserved.

inlineContent.text: This style produces formatted strings that break out a duration’s individual components, like “2 min, 3 sec”.
Create a
by providing a set of allowed

instances — such as hours, minutes, or seconds — for formatted strings to include. You also specify a width for displaying these units, which controls whether they appear as full words (“minutes”) or abbreviations (“min”). The initializers also take optional parameters to control things like the handling of zero units and fractional parts. Then create a formatted string by calling
on a duration, passing the style, or
on the style, passing a duration. You can also use the style’s
property to create a style that produces
instances, which contains attributes that indicate the unit value of formatted runs of the string.
In situations that expect a
, such as
, you can use the convenience function
to create a
, rather than using the full initializer.
If you want to reuse a style to format many durations, call
on the style, passing in a new duration each time.
The following example creates
to represent 1 hour, 10 minutes, 32 seconds, and 400 milliseconds. It then creates a
to show the hours, minutes, seconds, and milliseconds parts, with a wide width that presents the full name of each unit.
The formatted string omits any units that aren’t needed to accurately represent the value. In the above example, a duration of exactly one minute would format as
, omitting the hours, seconds, and milliseconds parts. To override this behavior and show the omitted units, use the initializer’s’
parameter.

abstract.text: Build apps using a powerful open language.
A type whose values can be implicitly or explicitly copied.
A type that can decode itself from an external representation.
A representation of high precision time.
A format style that shows durations in a compact, localized format with separators.
A property that formats the duration as an attributed string.
A format style that shows durations with localized labeled components
A format style that formats durations as attributed strings.
A strategy that determines how to format the fractional part of a duration if the allowed units can’t represent it exactly.
A unit to use in formatting a duration.
The width of a unit to use in formatting a duration.
A strategy that determines how to format a unit whose value is zero.
The units that may be included in the output string.
A property that formats the duration as an attributed string.
Creates a locale-aware string representation from a duration value.
The strategy for displaying a duration if it cannot be represented exactly with the allowed units.
Creates a units format style using the given parameters.
Creates a units format style using the given parameters.
The locale to use when formatting the duration.
A modifier to set the locale of the format style.
The maximum number of time units to include in the output string.
The width of the unit and the spacing between the value and the unit.
The padding or truncating behavior of the unit value.
The strategy for how zero-value units are handled.
Formats the string using a localized hour-minute-second time pattern.
Formats the duration, using the provided format style.
A type that can encode itself to an external representation.
A type that can be compared for value equality.
A type that can be hashed into a
to produce an integer hash value.
A thread-safe type whose values can be shared across arbitrary concurrent
contexts without introducing a risk of data races.
A value type for a string with associated attributes for portions of its text.
A type that converts a given data type into a representation in another type, such as a string.
